response.answer_text: ICT Stands for "Information and Communication Technologies." ICT refers to technologies that provide access to information through telecommunications. It is similar to Information Technology (IT), but focuses primarily on communication technologies. This includes the Internet, wireless networks, cell phones, and other communication mediums. In the past few decades, information and communication technologies have provided society with a vast array of new communication capabilities. For example, people can communicate in real-time with others in different countries using technologies such as instant messaging, voice over IP (VoIP), and video-conferencing. Social networking websites like Facebook allow users from all over the world to remain in contact and communicate on a regular basis.

In short it is anything that helps with communication. Be it radio, newspaper, social media, internet, you name it. It is comes into popularity now since the growth of smartphone, the term of ICT itself comes around 1980. The growth of nowadays ICT are simply because 3 billion people (out of 7 billion) are using the internet. 8 out of 10 of those internet user are having the smartphone, you can imagine how big the market of ICT is. It already spend around trillion of dollars and is keep growing, simply because of that ICT is becoming more and more heard now.
